page.title: 07LOCAL HISTORY-THE WELL
page.content: { {WELL-}Villagers at the beginning of this century relied on six or seven stand pipes in various parts of the village for their water. These stand pipes were cylindrical in shape, with a dome-shaped lid. On the front of the well,the water came out of a spout, around which was a lion's head. This gave these wells the name{Lions' Head {Wells.} Villagers used the wells as meeting points where people would discuss what had been happening in Star. Often, it was the children's job to fetch the water. They played tricks on each other by turning the handle on full when someone was having a drink, so soaking the person having a drink. In 1984 there was only one well left at the East End of Star, outside a ruined stone cottage which had once been lived in by{Duncan Rutherford. }
